name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - ITP to be submitted to the Engineer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version AND THAT THE NOTES OF THE PLANS ARE BEING FOLLOWED
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Site Inspection of Marked Out Sign Locations prior to any works to ensure no clashes and appropriate location for signs.
Standard / Specification - Refer to NZTA Traffic Control Device and MOTSAM
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure that subcontract and supplier agreements have been completed.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 20MPa grout mix to be used for signage footings.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Any steelwork shall be in accordance with NZS 3404: 1997. Structural steel plate shall comply with AS 3678 – 250.

○ Steel posts shall be grade ASTM 106, Grade B or AP15L, Grade B. Steel RHS posts shall comply with AS 1163: 1981 Grade 350. All steelwork shall be hot dip galvanised after manufacturer in accordance with AS 1650 unless otherwise stated.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prefered method of installation will be sockets
— These footings will be installed after kerbs have been poured and before the islands are poured.
— Socket installed into raised islands will be dug out and installed level with the kerbs.
— Excavate footings to minimum size of 300x300x600mm.
— Install sockets and pour concrete to finish level.
Standard / Specification - Refer to NZTA Traffic Control Device and MOTSAM
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prefered method of installation will be sockets
— These footings will be installed after kerbs have been poured and before the islands are poured.
— Socket installed into raised islands will be dug out and installed level with the kerbs.
— Excavate footings to minimum size of 300x300x600mm.
— Install sockets and pour concrete to finish level.
Standard / Specification - As shown in RITS
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Check signs and pole sizing against drawings.

○ Ensure sign is plumb, orientated correctly, correct height to underside of sign, correct offset from kerb, ID sticker is attached to back of the sign, correct bracket and channels used, all brackets secured tightly.
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Provide red-line markups for items that have been moved, modified, etc.
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
